section.title: Analytic Transformational Geometry
section.p: The goal is to develop matrix formulas for arbitrary isometries using the basic isometry formulas given below as building blocks.

statement.p: A point with normal coordinates (x,y) in homogeneous coordinates is written (x,y,1).

exercise.p: Goal: develop a rotation about a point [x_0,y_0]^T using the following steps.

ol.li: Find a transformation that moves [x_0,y_0]^T to the origin.
Find a transformation that moves [x_0,y_0]^T to the origin then rotates by \phi.
Find a transformation that moves [x_0,y_0]^T to the origin, rotates by \phi, then returns the origin to [x_0,y_0]^T.
State, using matrix notation, a transformation that rotates the plane about a point [x_0,y_0]^T by \phi.

exercise.p: Goal: develop a reflection about a vertical line given by x=a using the following steps.

ol.li: Find a transformation that move the line x=a to the y-axis.
Find a transformation that move the line x=a to the y-axis, then reflects the plane over the y-axis.
Find a transformation that move the line x=a to the y-axis, reflects the plane over the y-axis, then returns the y-axis to the line x=a.
State, using matrix notation, a transformation that reflects about an arbitrary vertical line x=a.

exercise.p: Goal: develop a reflection about a horizontal line given by y=b using the following steps.

ol.li: Find a transformation that move the line y=b to the x-axis.
Find a transformation that move the line y=b to the x-axis, then reflects the plane over the x-axis.
Find a transformation that move the line y=b to the x-axis, reflects the plane over the x-axis, then returns the x-axis to the line y=b.
State, using matrix notation, a transformation that reflects about an arbitrary horizontal line y=b.

exercise.p: Develop a reflection about an arbitrary (non-vertical) line.
